channel.title: [Mac OS X] Java editing apps
channel.description:
I was recently thinking back to when I used windows, wondering what I missed. I remembered a program called "Text Pad" which I used to edit my .java files.
Now I know IDE's are very good for doing this, but they use up a lot of memory and I don't particularly like running my server through one and much prefer using the Terminal.
I was wondering, are there any good text editors for mac? I am currently using "TextWrangler" which to be honest is great for the price (Free).
Any mac users know of any others?

item.title: [Mac OS X] Java editing apps
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

I heard that TextMate is quite good for the Mac: http://macromates.com/

item.description:

Eclipse doesn’t eat memory.

[Image too big to post, l0l]

http://imgur.com/Yd3WY
[/quote]
and now look at how much memory is being used by the java process…[/quote]
It still takes up hardly any memory (252MB) It may be a bit higher then other programs but that’s what you have to pay for using good program.

item.title: [Mac OS X] Java editing apps
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:14, topic:390989”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=486937.msg3569243#msg3569243 date=1302913643]
I think they got most KDE apps running on Mac, so use the best text editor ever, kate!

Seriously, I use it all the time, and it’s awesome.
[/quote]

its best text editor but ide’s are still better :)[/quote]

IDEs are better for certain things, but certainly not everything. I don’t want to edit configuration files or keep notes in an IDE for example.

Read full topic

Mac is a whole lot better than windows though.
